verses.name: Proverbs 29:1
verses.text: He, that being often reproved hardeneth his neck, shall suddenly be destroyed, and that without remedy.

verses.name: Proverbs 29:2
verses.text: When the righteous are in authority, the people rejoice: but when the wicked beareth rule, the people mourn.

verses.name: Proverbs 29:3
verses.text: Whoso loveth wisdom rejoiceth his father: but he that keepeth company with harlots spendeth his substance.

verses.name: Proverbs 29:4
verses.text: The king by judgment establisheth the land: but he that receiveth gifts overthroweth it.

verses.name: Proverbs 29:5
verses.text: A man that flattereth his neighbour spreadeth a net for his feet.

verses.name: Proverbs 29:6
verses.text: In the transgression of an evil man there is a snare: but the righteous doth sing and rejoice.

verses.name: Proverbs 29:7
verses.text: The righteous considereth the cause of the poor: but the wicked regardeth not to know it.

verses.name: Proverbs 29:8
verses.text: Scornful men bring a city into a snare: but wise men turn away wrath.

verses.name: Proverbs 29:9
verses.text: If a wise man contendeth with a foolish man, whether he rage or laugh, there is no rest.

verses.name: Proverbs 29:10
verses.text: The bloodthirsty hate the upright: but the just seek his soul.

verses.name: Proverbs 29:11
verses.text: A fool uttereth all his mind: but a wise man keepeth it in till afterwards.

verses.name: Proverbs 29:12
verses.text: If a ruler hearken to lies, all his servants are wicked.

verses.name: Proverbs 29:13
verses.text: The poor and the deceitful man meet together: the Lord lighteneth both their eyes.

verses.name: Proverbs 29:14
verses.text: The king that faithfully judgeth the poor, his throne shall be established for ever.

verses.name: Proverbs 29:15
verses.text: The rod and reproof give wisdom: but a child left to himself bringeth his mother to shame.

verses.name: Proverbs 29:16
verses.text: When the wicked are multiplied, transgression increaseth: but the righteous shall see their fall.

verses.name: Proverbs 29:17
verses.text: Correct thy son, and he shall give thee rest; yea, he shall give delight unto thy soul.

verses.name: Proverbs 29:18
verses.text: Where there is no vision, the people perish: but he that keepeth the law, happy is he.

verses.name: Proverbs 29:19
verses.text: A servant will not be corrected by words: for though he understand he will not answer.

verses.name: Proverbs 29:20
verses.text: Seest thou a man that is hasty in his words? there is more hope of a fool than of him.

verses.name: Proverbs 29:21
verses.text: He that delicately bringeth up his servant from a child shall have him become his son at the length.

verses.name: Proverbs 29:22
verses.text: An angry man stirreth up strife, and a furious man aboundeth in transgression.

verses.name: Proverbs 29:23
verses.text: A man’s pride shall bring him low: but honour shall uphold the humble in spirit.

verses.name: Proverbs 29:24
verses.text: Whoso is partner with a thief hateth his own soul: he heareth cursing, and bewrayeth it not.

verses.name: Proverbs 29:25
verses.text: The fear of man bringeth a snare: but whoso putteth his trust in the Lord shall be safe.

verses.name: Proverbs 29:26
verses.text: Many seek the ruler’s favour; but every man’s judgment cometh from the Lord.

verses.name: Proverbs 29:27
verses.text: An unjust man is an abomination to the just: and he that is upright in the way is abomination to the wicked.
